title: Hotel Galvez Ghost Tour Dinners in Galveston
address: 2024 Seawall Blvd Galveston, TX 77550 United States
body: Hotel Galvez & Spa opens its ghost tour, typically reserved for guests, to the public as part of a dinner tour package on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays in October. During the tour, their staff will guide participants through the ghostly past of the hotel which is then followed by dinner in the Galvez Bar & Grill. Admission: Tickets are $45.

title: King’s Cares: Playground for All Abilities at King’s BierHaus
address: 2044 E. T.C. Jester Boulevard Houston, TX 77008 United States
body: Enjoy an all-day reverse happy hour as King's Bierhaus features 100-year old recipes in a modern fusion of German, Austrian, and American cuisine. Happy hour times will be 3pm to 6pm and 9pm to 11pm. 20% of proceeds will be donated to the accessible playground fund. Admission No cover.

title: Galveston Appreciation Day at the Pleasure Pier
address: 2501 Seawall Blvd Galveston, TX 77550 United States
body: The Galveston Island Historic Pleasure Pier hosts Galveston Appreciation Day with deals on rides and the 31st Annual Sailing of the Harvest Moon Regatta at 2pm. Admission $15.99 for all-day ride passes.

title: Blues and More at the Brown at George R. Brown Convention
address: 1001 Avenida De Las Americas Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Students from the special arts programs at Houston's internationally renowned High School for the Performing and Visual Arts will be dazzling lunchtime guests on the Avenida Wharf with live concerts and performances. Admission Free to attend.

title: Satan’s Chicken Pop Up at West Alabama Ice House
address: 1919 W Alabama St Houston , TX 77098 United States
body: Socialize and have a beer all while holding a spicy chicken sandwich in your hand at the Satan's Chicken Pop Up at West Alabama Ice House. Admission No cover.

title: Happy Hour Thursdays at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston
address: 1001 Bissonnet Houston, TX 77005 United States
body: Bring your friends to a museum-style happy hour and enjoy the exhibitions, bites from food trucks, and specialty cocktails at the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston. Admission Free to attend.

title: The Original Greek Festival at Annunciation Greek Orthodox Cathedral
address: 3511 Yoakum Blvd. Houston, TX 77006 United States
body: Learn about Greek culture at the 51st Annual Original Greek Festival at the Annunciation Greek Orthodox Cathedral in Montrose. This family-friendly event will feature the finest in Greek cuisine, kids activities, music and more. Admission Tickets start at $5. Children under 12 get in free.

title: Karbachtoberfest at Karbach Brewing Co.
address: 2032 Karbach St Houston, TX 77092 United States
body: Celebrate Karbachtoberfest with four weekends of festivities, a German inspired menu, beer, live performances by Otis the Destroyer and more. Admission: Free to Attend.

title: First Thursday on Mid Main ( Block Party )
address: 3700 Main St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Enjoy live music, art, complimentary beverages, local vendors and more for a good cause at this block party. Admisison: $5 cover charge.

title: Fall Concert Series at Market Street
address: 9595 Six Pines Drive The Woodlands, TX 77380 United States
body: Market Street’s fall concert series, featuring artists in country, rock, acoustic and more, returns to the shopping, dining and entertainment destination in The Woodlands. This event is free to attend. Blankets and lawn chairs are welcome.

title: Oktoberfest 2017 at Memorial City
address: 303 Memorial City Way Houston, TX 77024 United States
body: Experience a taste of Oktoberfest at Memorial City’s outdoor green space, The Square. Enjoy an evening of German-themed fun with refreshing sips from Houston's microbreweries, Saint Arnold and Karbach, while eating Bavarian-style food and dancing to live German folk music. Admission No cover.

title: Craft Social: Experimental Sound at Houston Center for Contemporary Craft
address: 4848 Main St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Join the Houston Center for Contemporary Craft for their Craft Social, a night of making and exploring contemporary craft over conversation and refreshments. This month, you can explore experimental sound, inspired by the works on view in their current exhibition The Sound of Things. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Flocktoberfest at the Houston Zoo
address: 200 Hermann Park Dr Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: Flock, Houston Zoo's Young Professionals host Flocktoberfest, an event featuring delicious food from local eateries, each specially paired with a refreshing Saint Arnold brew. Attend Keeper Chats throughout the night, meet some of our Ambassador Animals, all while listening to great music. Admission Free for members; $40 for nonmembers; $50 for nonmembers at the door.

title: Thursday Night Concerts: Ty Herndon at Discovery Green
address: 1500 Mckinney St Houston, TX 77010 United States
body: Enjoy an outdoor concert by Ty Herndon and openers The Band Hennessy at this Show Your Pride Night at Discovery Green park. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: 38th Annual Festival Chicano at Miller Outdoor Theatre
address: 6000 Hermann Park Drive Houston, TX 77030 United States
body: Head to the 38th Annual Festival Chicano, a cultural celebration of Chicano music from Tejano and Conjunto, to Mariachi and Orchestra at the Miller Outdoor Theatre. Admission This event is free to attend.

title: Houston Dynamo vs. Cruz Azul at BBVA Compass Stadium
address: 2200 Texas St Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Cheer on the Dynamo as they hit the field to play against Cruz Azul at the BBVA Compass Stadium. Admission Tickets start at $30. The Legends game is slated for 7pm; the Cruz Azul friendly game starts at 8pm.

title: Houston Rockets vs. Shanghai Sharks
address: 1510 Polk St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: The Sharks will travel to Clutch City for a Preseason game against our Houston Rockets at Toyota Center. Admission Tickets start at $23.

title: Lynyrd Skynyrd in Concert at Smart Financial Centre
address: 18111 Lexington Boulevard Sugar Land, TX 77479 United States
body: Go to guitar rock heaven as southern rock legends, Lynyrd Skynyrd come to the Smart Financial Centre at Sugar Land with special guest Molly Hatchet. Admission Tickets start at $39.50.

title: Giuda in Concert at White Oak Music Hall
address: 2915 N Main Street Houston, TX 77009 United States
body: The 5-piece band Giuda comes all the way from Italy to play their anthemic hooks at White Oak Music Hall with openers The Genzales, Bayou Vimana and Liberty and Justice Music. Admission Tickets start at $12.

title: Full Moon Tour at 1892 Bishop’s Palace
address: 1402 Broadway Galveston, TX 77550 United States
body: Experience Bishop’s Palace in a whole new light, the moonlight, on their upcoming Full Moon Tour where you can explore this National Historic Landmark in Galveston. Admission Tickets are $30.

title: Story Hole 2: Holidays and Hurricanes at Rec Room
address: 100 Jackson St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Join Houston's LGBTQ community for an evening of humorous stories about holidays and hurricanes at the Rec Room. There will be a show at 8pm and 10pm. Admission Tickets are $10.

title: Run the Jewels in Concert at Revention Music Center
address: 520 Texas St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Catch producer El-P and rapper Killer Mike, also known as Run the Jewels, at Revention Music Center. Admission Tickets start at $35.

title: Trackstar The DJ (Run the Jewels) at The Nightingale Room
address: 308 Main St Houston, TX 77002 United States
body: Head to The Nightingale Room for a special late night DJ set from Trackstar The DJ from the hip-hop group Run the Jewels. Admission $5 at the door.

title: Brand New Wave: ’80s Dance Party at The Secret Group
address: 2101 Polk Street Houston, TX 77003 United States
body: Dance to the sounds of the '80s with DJ Zero during The Secret Group's Brand New Wave dance night. Admission No cover.
